alert.note: Alert for Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued March 27 at 7:50PM MDT until March 28 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FOR TUESDAY AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING FOR THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS AND NORTHEAST PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... .Winds will turn strong over the northeast highlands and adjacent northeastern plains on Tuesday afternoon, leading the potential for more marginally critical to critical fire weather conditions. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Plains (Zone 104) Fire Weather Watch for Tuesday from 1 pm to 7 pm MDT. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West to northwest 20 to 25 mph with occasional gusts to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from about 15 to 20 percent on Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
